title.narrative: OUTPUT 5.3: CHILD PROTECTION IN HUMANITA

description.narrative: Vulnerable children in humanitarian settings, especially children associated with armed forces or armed groups, unaccompanied and separated children, displaced children and survivors of sexual and gender-based violence,, which contributes to Access To Justice, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, children and adolescents, especially the most vulnerable, are protected from violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Vulnerable children in humanitarian settings, especially children associated with armed forces or armed groups, unaccompanied and separated children, displaced children and survivors of sexual and gender-based violence,

Core prevention and response interventions addressing violence against children through UNICEF-supported programmes (adapted to context of COVID-19): (a) number of mothers, fathers and caregivers reached through parenting programmes; and (b) number of girls and boys who have experienced violence reached by health, social work or justice/law enforcement services Number of children who have experienced violence reached by health, social work and/or law enforcement/justice (adapted for delivery dur

[Number of United Nations Secretary General's Report on Children and Armed Conflict issues jointly with the UN Mission]" at provincial and national level] Nombre de rapports du Secrtaire Gnral des Nations Unies sur le sort des enfants en temps de conflit arm mis de manire conjointe avec la Mission des Nations Unies.

[Number of children associated with armed forces/groups who benefited from community based socio-economic reintegration] Nombre de filles et de garons associs des groupes arms ayant bnfici d'une rintgration socio-conomique dans leurs communauts.

[Number of vulnerable children who benefited from MHPSS provisions at various levels i.e., Child, Adolescents, Care-givers and Community] Nombre d'enfants vulnrables ayant bnfici d'assistance psychosociale des niveaux varis: enfant, adolescents, prestataires de soin et communauts

[Number of Unaccompanied and Separated Children (UASC) reunified with their families or provided with long term solutions] Nombre d'enfants non-accompagns ou spars ayant bnfici d'une runification avec leurs familles ou d'une solution long-terme.

[Number of girls and boys survivors of SGBV provided with a comprehensive response] Nombre de filles et garons survivants de violences sexuelles et bases sur le genre ayant bnfici d'une rponse holistique.
Number of women and children in humanitarian situations who received Gender-Based Violence (GBV) response services through UNICEF-supported programmes
Status of alternative care policies and programmes adapted to respond to the COVID-19 Pandemic [COVID]
